TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {8843=“Cabaret Verboten” is a collection of cabaret songs and sketches from more than 20 composers and writers from early ‘30s Germany; some, like Bertolt Brecht and Hanns Eisler, are familiar names, but most have been rescued from obscurity by the show’s conceiver, Jeremy Lawrence. When Lawrence premiered the show back in 1991, it received tepid reviews from the press. But it’s hard to imagine this much-improved revision failing to delight or provoke any fan of socially conscious musical theater, handled as it is by an exceptional quartet of local performers.}
